name: Dilled Shrimp (Rejer)
author: WOLSELEY
summary: You can't have a Danish holiday meal without endless platters of dilled shrimp. Served on a red serving platter, it makes the perfect Christmas dish that will have your guests heaping up pyramids of shrimp on their plates.  No Scandinavian buffet would be complete without it!
directions: Bring water to a boil in a large pot over high heat
Add salt, sugar, and dill sprigs; stir until sugar has dissolved
Pour in shrimp and cook until the shells turn pink, and the meat is no longer translucent, 3 to 4 minutes
Strain the shrimp through a colander, discard dill sprigs, and chill until cold in the refrigerator, about 30 minutes
Once shrimp have cooled, peel and devein them; discard the shells
Whisk together oil, vinegar, minced dill, salt, and pepper; toss with shrimp meat to coat
Cover, and chill overnight in the refrigerator; serve with sprigs of fresh dill
